title: Consumer Products Manufacturing: Made in the USA - Assembly Magazine
summary: Many consumer products are still made in the United States, including brushes, flashlights, jewelry, lighters, knives, markers, padlocks, pens, razors, scissors and watches. Many consumers want to buy products made in the United States, but often do not see them while shopping.  Companies that supply U.S. markets are re-evaluating where they assemble products because of supply chain disruptions in China and Taiwan.
likely_naics_codes: ['332510 - Hardware Manufacturing', '339999 - All Other Miscellaneous Manufacturing', '325998 - All Other Fabricated Metal Product Manufacturing', '332999 - All Other Fabricated Metal Product Manufacturing']

title: China to hold first forum on sustainability in the cosmetics industry - Premium beauty
summary: The International Forum on Beauty Economy and Green Innovation, together with the Conference on High Quality Development of China Cosmetics and Household Chemicals Industries, will be held in Beijing, China on July 11th and 12th, 2023. The Forum will focus on hot topics in green innovation, including green materials, ecodesign and green manufacturing, green packaging, and green products. The Forum aims to build an international exchange platform for the beauty and household chemicals industries to share knowledge and explore the development direction of the industry.

title: Manufacturing and the Circular Economy | ASSEMBLY - Assembly Magazine
summary: BMW is leading a project to improve the circular economy in automotive manufacturing by exploring ways to improve the quality of secondary raw materials obtained from recycling end-of-life vehicles. This project is backed by $7 million from the Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Climate Action in Germany. BMW has also set a goal of increasing the proportion of secondary materials in its brands' new models from around 30 percent to 50 percent.
green_innovation: TRUE, the project is exploring ways to improve the quality of secondary raw materials obtained from recycling end-of-life vehicles, which contributes to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE, the project is developing new technologies to automate and speed up recycling processes, which could lead to a new or improved business process for one or more business functions.
green_product: FALSE, the article does not describe a specific green product.
green_process: TRUE, the project is developing new technologies to improve the quality and quantity of the recovered materials, which could lead to a new or improved green process for recycling end-of-life vehicles.

title: Bringing sustainable supply chain practices to Africa - Businessday
summary: Sustainable supply chain practices are crucial for reducing CO2 emissions and other harmful pollutants, as well as protecting the environment and its people. Companies can implement sustainable supply chain practices by employing green purchasing, manufacturing, warehousing, packaging, and transportation. These practices include using recycled materials, improving product packaging, and communicating sustainable initiatives to consumers.
green_innovation: TRUE, as the article discusses implementing environmentally and socially sustainable practices across the entire gamut of the supply chain process to reduce CO2 emissions.
business_innovation: TRUE, as the article provides examples of companies rethinking material components and using recycled materials to reduce their environmental impact and improve their supply chain efficiency.
green_product: TRUE, as the article mentions that using recycled materials and streamlining packaging can lead to the creation of environmentally friendly products and reduced plastic footprints.
green_process: TRUE, as the article discusses the importance of using green processes to minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability.

title: Zouk Launches Flagship Store at Nexus Seawoods, Mumbai - Indian Retailer
summary: The Indian beauty and personal care segment, which was valued at over Rs 54,500 crore two years ago, is expected to grow at a 11 percent CAGR over the next five years. E-commerce has become the go-to option for consumers, with online sales expected to make up 30 percent of the market by 2027. Brands are focusing on sustainability, with many launching new products and initiatives that are environmentally friendly.
